TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit FileDialogCustomPlacesCollection extends System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1<class System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCustomPlace>

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of [!INCLUDE[wiprlhext](~/add/includes/wiprlhext-md.md)] custom places for the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks On [!INCLUDE[winxp](~/add/includes/winxp-md.md)] or [!INCLUDE[winxpsvr](~/add/includes/winxpsvr-md.md)], this class does not have any effect.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the FileDialogCustomPlacesCollection. To run this example, paste the following code into a Windows Form and call `InitializeDialogAndButton` from the form's constructor or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> event-handling method.
[!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCommonPlaces#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.f_7_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCommonPlaces#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.f_7_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Add(valuetype System.Guid knownFolderGuid) cil managed

Docs.param: A <xref:System.Guid> that represents a [!INCLUDE[wiprlhext](~/add/includes/wiprlhext-md.md)] Known Folder.
Docs.summary: Adds a custom place to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The folder is added to custom places only for a particular <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FileDialog> and is not a system or application wide change.
The folders are positioned in the custom places in the order that they are added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FileDialog>. The last one added will be at the top. If you add a custom place to the collection that does not exist on the computer running the application, the custom place will not be shown. GUIDs are case-insensitive. For a list of the available [!INCLUDE[wiprlhext](~/add/includes/wiprlhext-md.md)] Known Folders, see [Known Folder GUIDs for File Dialog Custom Places](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) or the KnownFolders.h file in the [!INCLUDE[winSDK](~/add/includes/winsdk-md.md)].
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the Add method. To run this example, paste the following code into a Windows Form and call `InitializeDialogAndButton` from the form's constructor or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> event-handling method.
[!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCommonPlaces#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.windows.forms.f_6_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCommonPlaces#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.windows.forms.f_6_1.cs)]

Docs.param: A folder path to the custom place.
Docs.summary: Adds a custom place to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The folder is added to custom places only for a particular <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FileDialog> and is not a system or application wide change.
The folders are positioned in the custom places in the order that they are added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FileDialog>. The last one added will be at the top.
